data.enText: shaking and feeling weak because you are ill/sick, emotional or old
Her voice sounded shaky on the phone.
data.chText: 电话里她的声音听着发颤。

data.enText: The old man was very shaky on his feet.
data.chText: 老人站在那儿，颤巍巍的。

data.enText: not firm or safe; not certain
data.chText: 不稳固的；不牢靠的；摇晃的；不确切的

data.enText: That ladder looks a little shaky.
Her memories of the accident are a little shaky.
data.chText: 那次事故她记不太清楚了。

data.enText: The protesters are on shaky ground (= it is not certain that their claims are valid) .
not seeming very successful; likely to fail
data.chText: 不大出色的；成问题的；可能失败的

data.enText: Business is looking shaky at the moment.
data.chText: 从目前看，业务举步维艰。

data.enText: After a shaky start, they fought back to win 3–2.
data.chText: 他们开局不顺，但最终以3:2反败为胜。

tr: inclined to shake as from weakness or defect
example: a wobbly chair with shaky legs
the ladder felt a little wobbly
the bridge still stands though one of the arches is wonky

tr: as e.g. with fear or cold or like the leaves of an aspen in a breeze
example: the quaking child asked for more
quivering leaves of a poplar tree
sparkling light from the shivering crystals of the chandelier

example.ex: A shaky ceasefire is holding after three days of fighting between rival groups...
example.tran: 敌对武装团伙在经过3天的交战后暂时停火。

example.ex: I'm afraid that this school year is off to a shaky start...
example.tran: 恐怕这学年一开学就不顺。

example.ex: The Prime Minister's political position is becoming increasingly shaky.
example.tran: 首相的政治地位正摇摇欲坠。

value.def: If you describe a situation as shaky, you mean that it is weak or unstable, and seems unlikely to last long or be successful.
value.tran: 不稳固的;不牢靠的;不会长久的;不会成功的

example.ex: We have all had a shaky hand and a dry mouth before speaking in public...
example.tran: 当众发言前，我们全都手脚发抖，嘴巴发干。

example.ex: Even small operations can leave you feeling a bit shaky...
example.tran: 即使是小手术也会让你有点战战兢兢。

example.ex: His speech was difficult to understand, his signature shaky and unrecognizable.
example.tran: 他的演说很难听懂，他的签名颤颤巍巍地无法识别。

value.def: If your body or your voice is shaky, you cannot control it properly and it shakes, for example because you are ill or nervous.

example.ex: He made his way down the aircraft steps unaided but moved shakily as he did so...
example.tran: 他独自一人走下了飞机梯级，双腿颤巍巍的。
